cluster_relations.rel_desc: Birds help maintain overall biodiversity by supporting plant reproduction and dispersal.

qualifiers.OtherQualifier: Pathway: via plant reproduction and colonization

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Habitat loss represents a shift in environmental conditions that changes ecosystem condition.
remarks: Direction chosen from habitat loss to ecosystem condition as the pressure altering conditions.

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Pollution is an environmental pressure that changes overall ecosystem condition.
Climate change acts as a large-scale driver altering environmental conditions and ecosystem condition.

args.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject contributes to maintaining or sustaining the state or level of the object over time.
args.justification: The relation describes birds contributing to maintaining overall biodiversity via ecological functions; this is best modeled as the subject supporting the maintenance of the ecosystem-level object rather than a generic causal or identity link.

args.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject pressure or driver causes changes in the overall condition or state of an ecosystem.
args.justification: All three relations link environmental pressures (habitat loss, pollution, climate change) to ecosystem condition, with descriptions explicitly stating they change or alter ecosystem condition; a shared, more precise predicate captures this causal alteration.

All relations describe entities (species or pressures) influencing high-level ecosystem properties (biodiversity or ecosystem condition), so they belong to a common class capturing influences on ecosystem state.

Each relation encodes a causal or quasi-causal effect: birds help maintain biodiversity, and environmental pressures (habitat loss, pollution, climate change) alter ecosystem condition; this squarely fits a causal grouping.
